page.title: 17NORFOLK STREET,WISBECH.
page.content: Norfolk Street is a narrow shopping thoroughfare on the edge of the main business district of the town.It is the home for many small and useful concerns. In recent years it has been suggested that the street be pedestrianised to alleviate the problems caused by the narrowness of the street.If Norfolk Street was changed it would another chapter in the story of this area of the town. In 1820 Norfolk St.was known as Timber Market(because it was paved with Timber blocks).Among the businesses to be found then were butchers,shoe-makers,confectioners,fur niture-brokers,grocers,bakers,basket-m akers,blacksmiths,book-sellers, brewers,chemists,tea-dealers,rope-make rs and saddlers. Today as in 1820 the street has a variety of shops and businesses.
